newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL -- Alex. Brown leaps.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL -- Alex. Brown leaps.

text.p: Alex. Brown Inc shares moved sharply higher before Monday's U.S. market open on news of its merger with Bankers Trust New York Corp, traders said.
The combination was among a number of big mergers the market was digesting ahead of Monday's opening bell.
In pre-open trade, Alex. Brown stock traded at 58, above the 53-1/8 last trade on the New York Stock Exchange Friday, they said.
The companies last night agreed to merge in a $1.7 billion stock swap. Each Alex. Brown share would be exchanged for 0.83 shares of Banker Trust common stock, they said.
"The good news is that it jump-starts their (Bankers Trust's) U.S. equities business; the bad news is that they're paying a lot," said a Wall Steet analyst Raphael Soifer of Brown Bros. Harriman.
He stressed that he was speaking ahead of a company conference call.
Bankers Trust finished trading last week at 82-1/4, and traders said they expected early weakness in the stock related to the transaction.
Among other shares active before the open were: Microsoft Corp, up to 95-1/2 from 94-3/16, Cisco Systems, up to 53 from 50-7/8, Intel Corp, up to 146 from 145, and Parametric Tech, off 2-1/8 to 43.
